thread.title: Get your Halloween movie fix in Fort Collins
thread.title_full: Get your Halloween movie fix in Fort Collins

title: Get your Halloween movie fix in Fort Collins
text:
Get your Halloween movie fix in Fort Collins Erin Udell 2:09 p.m. MDT October 12, 2015 Kathy Najimy (left), Bette Midler and Sarah Jessica Parker star as 17th century witches who accidentally find themselves in modern day Salem, Massachusetts in ‘Hocus Pocus.’ (Photo: Buena Vista Pictures) 12 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Before you know it, Halloween will be here and gone. 
So as the leaves continue to fall, temperatures drop and pumpkins perch on porches, make the most of it this October by getting in the spirit with some movies that scream Halloween. 
Whether you want to watch three 17th-century witches navigate 1993 or a sweet transvestite from sensational Transylvania, here’s where to find your Halloween movie fix in Fort Collins. 
In town 
The Village Vidiot, 1220 W. Elizabeth St. 
Halloween season starts early at the family-owned Village Vidiot, Fort Collins’ last remaining video store. 
“Today, I just put away 10 different (Halloween movies),” owner Scott Shepherd said last week. 
His customers’ interests are usually across the board — from gory horror flicks to classic family-friendly films — and he tries to stay prepared for the surge, keeping several copies of movies that tend to fly off the shelves this spooky season. 
Top titles at the Vidiot in October: 
“Friday the 13th” (R) 
“Halloween” (R) and “Halloween II” (R) 
“Hocus Pocus” (PG) 
“It’s the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown” 
“Practical Magic” (PG-13) 
“The Shining” (R) 
Tim Burton films like “Beetlejuice” (PG), “Corpse Bride” (PG), “Edward Scissorhands” (PG-13) “The Nightmare Before Christmas” (PG) and “Sleepy Hollow” (R). 
“Trick or Treat” (R) 
Rates vary for one-, three- and five-night rentals but stay between $1.99 and $5.49. 
In theaters 
Lyric Cinema Cafe, 300 E. Mountain Ave. 
Oct. 9-15: “Beetlejuice” (PG) 
Oct. 16-18: “Dude Bro Party Massacre III” 
Oct. 23-29: “A Nightmare on Elm Street” (R) 
Oct. 24: “Night of the Living Dead” (NR) (screening at 11 p.m., $6 tickets) 
Oct. 30-31: “ The Rocky Horror Picture Show” (R) 
Online 
“The Legend of Sleepy Hollow” (NR) 
“Halloween” (R) 
“The Blair Witch Project” (R) 
“Carrie” (2013 - R) 
“Night of the Living Dead” (NR) 
Netflix
